Name: Statue of Hor, Priest of Thoth
Description: This life-size statue of Hor, a priest of Thoth, is sculpted in the Egyptian style. It shows the strong influence of Egyptian art during the Roman Period. He is wearing a Persian-style tunic with his right arm by his side and the left folded over his abdomen, holding a flap of his cloak. The statue is supported by a pillar that bears hieroglyphic inscriptions indicating that the statue belongs to Hor, the Priest of Thoth.
